episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing historical and contemporary topics, including P.T. Barnum's attempt to purchase Shakespeare's birthplace, the Venetian government's extreme measures to protect mirror-making secrets, the creation of the world's longest car, and amusingly named ancient British fruit varieties.

facts.fact: P.T. Barnum once tried to buy William Shakespeare's birthplace and transport it to America.
In 1547, the Venetian government assassinated two men to stop them from revealing how mirrors were made.
The longest car in the world was so long that it had a literal backseat driver.
Ancient British fruit varieties include the Hens turd apple and the bloody bastard pear.
